title: Model editor: support joints to the world

content.raw:
It would be nice to be able to specify the world as the parent of a joint in the editor.

A more pressing issue is to at least not remove joints to the world, as it's currently doing:

1. Open a world which has a joint to the world, for example: `force_torque_demo.world`

1. Right-click the model which has the joint to the world and select "Edit Model"

1. Don't change anything, just exit and save

1. Back in simulation, when you press play, the model falls because the joint has been removed
content.html:
It would be nice to be able to specify the world as the parent of a joint in the editor.

A more pressing issue is to at least not remove joints to the world, as it's currently doing:

  1. Open a world which has a joint to the world, for example: force_torque_demo.world

  2. Right-click the model which has the joint to the world and select "Edit Model"

  3. Don't change anything, just exit and save

  4. Back in simulation, when you press play, the model falls because the joint has been removed
